predictions.text: ServiceNow will announce a definitive agreement to acquire Armis by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if ServiceNow or Armis issues an official press release or SEC filing announcing a signed definitive merger/acquisition agreement where ServiceNow is acquiring Armis (any consideration structure). Rumors/leaks without confirmation do not count.
evidence: Reported acquisition talks indicate strategic interest in cybersecurity consolidation and platform-led M&A.
Large-cap software firms often pursue security acquisitions to expand ARR and enterprise footprint.
monitoring_signals: ServiceNow investor relations press releases and 8-K filings
Armis press releases/blog
Regulatory filings (US SEC, EU merger control notifications)
Major deal reporters (WSJ, Bloomberg, CNBC) followed by company confirmation
predictions.rationale: Talks can fail due to price, diligence, or antitrust, so probability is meaningfully below 50% despite credible reporting.

predictions.text: iRobot will publicly disclose (via press release or SEC filing) a signed agreement to sell substantially all assets or the company (a sale transaction) out of bankruptcy by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if iRobot (or a court-appointed entity) announces a signed asset purchase agreement or merger agreement during the Chapter 11 process, documented in an iRobot press release, 8-K/10-Q/10-K, or bankruptcy court filing. Mere bidding procedures approval without a signed deal is NO.
evidence: Chapter 11 processes frequently culminate in a 363 asset sale or plan sale transaction.
Going-private/restructuring narratives often still require a formal sale agreement under court oversight.
monitoring_signals: iRobot SEC filings (8-K) and press releases
Bankruptcy docket (bidding procedures, stalking horse, sale motion, sale order)
Creditor committee updates and court hearing schedules
predictions.rationale: Bankruptcy increases odds of an eventual sale, though outcomes can include stand-alone reorganization or liquidation without a signed sale agreement.

predictions.text: At least one publicly confirmed direct meeting between official delegations from Ukraine and Russia (in-person or virtual) will occur by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if either government (Ukraine or Russia) publicly confirms a direct meeting between official delegations (e.g., foreign ministry, defense, presidential office) for peace/cease-fire talks. Indirect talks via intermediaries only are NO.
evidence: Public signaling of flexibility around talks can precede exploratory contacts.
Historical precedent of intermittent negotiation attempts even amid ongoing conflict.
monitoring_signals: Official statements from Ukraine’s President/Foreign Ministry
Russian government statements and MFA releases
Turkey/UN/OSCE facilitation announcements
Credible wire services (Reuters/AP) confirmations
predictions.rationale: Even with talk signals, domestic politics and battlefield dynamics often block direct delegation-level meetings on short horizons.

predictions.text: Australia’s federal government will introduce (table) a bill in Parliament specifically targeting online misinformation/deepfakes or violent-extremist content amplification by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if a bill is formally introduced in the House of Representatives or Senate and its stated purpose includes combating misinformation/deepfakes and/or tightening online extremist-content rules (as described in the bill’s explanatory memorandum or official summary). Consult the Australian Parliament bill register.
evidence: High-profile violence events commonly trigger legislative responses on content moderation and platform accountability.
Recent attention to AI-driven misinformation increases policy momentum.
monitoring_signals: Australian Parliament bills register and Hansard
Attorney-General and Communications Minister announcements
eSafety Commissioner consultations
Exposure drafts or consultation papers preceding tabling
predictions.rationale: Political salience is high, but drafting, consultation, and coalition dynamics can delay formal introduction past the quarter.

predictions.text: Chile’s new administration will submit an executive-sponsored public security/anti-crime legislative package to the National Congress by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if the Chilean executive branch (presidency/ministry) formally presents a bill or bundled set of bills labeled as a security/anti-crime package to the National Congress, confirmed on official government or Congress websites.
evidence: Election outcomes driven by crime fears typically translate into early agenda-setting on security.
New administrations often prioritize high-visibility public safety legislation in their first months.
monitoring_signals: Chile government press releases (Presidency, Interior Ministry)
Chamber of Deputies/Senate bill tracking systems
Inaugural address and first 100-day agenda announcements
predictions.rationale: Given the stated political mandate around crime, a formal package submission is more likely than not within the first months in office.

predictions.text: The U.S. Navy will award at least one new shipbuilding-related contract (new award, not an option exercise) with announced total value of $1.0B or more by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if the U.S. Department of Defense posts a contract announcement explicitly related to shipbuilding/shipyards/shipbuilding industrial base with value ≥ $1.0B, and it is a new award (not merely exercising a previously awarded option).
evidence: Shipbuilding procurement routinely features billion-dollar awards and modifications, reflecting program scale.
Industrial-base emphasis increases likelihood of large awards/initiatives.
monitoring_signals: DoD daily contract announcements
Navy procurement (NAVSEA) press releases
Major shipbuilder IR updates (HII, General Dynamics)
predictions.rationale: Base rates for large naval shipbuilding awards are high, especially across a full quarter, making this a relatively high-confidence operational forecast.

predictions.text: KOSPI (South Korea) will close at or below 2,500 on at least one trading day by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if the KOSPI official close (as published by Korea Exchange or widely-cited market data providers like Refinitiv/Bloomberg) is ≤ 2,500 on any trading day on or before 2026-03-31 (UTC date).
evidence: Regional equities are sensitive to China-demand signals and global liquidity/earnings revisions.
Year-end and early-year windows can see outsized moves under thin liquidity and risk repricing.
monitoring_signals: Daily KOSPI close levels from KRX and major data vendors
China macro releases impacting Asia cyclicals
KRW moves and foreign net flows into Korean equities
predictions.rationale: Downside tail risk exists, but the threshold may require a nontrivial shock or sustained risk-off period, keeping probability below 50%.

predictions.text: A hyperscale cloud provider (AWS, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud) will publicly announce a pilot or customer availability for glass-based archival storage media (e.g., 5D glass/ultra-long-life glass storage) by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if AWS, Microsoft, or Google Cloud publishes a blog post, press release, conference talk, or product note stating a pilot/customer trial/availability using glass-based data storage media for archival/cold storage. Lab research without provider participation is NO.
evidence: Data-center pilots are being explored for high-density, long-term archival alternatives.
Hyperscalers continually test new storage tiers to reduce long-run TCO and energy costs.
monitoring_signals: AWS/Azure/Google Cloud blogs and conference keynotes
Partner announcements from glass-storage vendors
Patents and research collaborations tied to hyperscalers
predictions.rationale: Technical feasibility is progressing, but hyperscalers are conservative about announcing media changes; many pilots remain undisclosed or limited to research partnerships.
